answer: Hello! I'm Alton Core, your on-site assistant. I can help with navigation, quotes, printer selection, uploads, and account issues. How can I help you today?

To request a quote: 1) Open the 'Printers' page; 2) Choose a verified printer; 3) Click 'Request Quote' and provide your specifications (material, quantity, turnaround). You'll receive bids from partners and can accept one to proceed.
For account issues, go to the 'Login' page. We recommend using a strong password and enabling two-factor authentication when available. For lost passwords use 'Reset Password' on the login form.

To join as a verified printer, visit the 'Printers' -> 'Apply' section and submit your facility details, calibration records, and fulfillment history. Our team will review and, upon approval, add the 'Verified' badge.

To upload a design, open the 'Studio' or 'Upload' area, select your file (SVG, PNG, PDF recommended), and follow the prompts to set dimensions and print preferences. You can then request a quote or save as a template.

Shipping and delivery times depend on the selected printer and your chosen turnaround option. After accepting a quote, you'll see estimated delivery windows in the order summary. For urgent jobs, choose 'expedited' and contact the printer for confirmation.

If your print doesn't meet the quality standards, open a support request via the 'Orders' page and provide photos. Verified printers must resolve quality disputes; refunds are processed if remediation fails. See the 'Returns' section in our Terms for full policy.
You can contact our support team from the 'Help' page or by emailing support@alton.studio. For order-specific issues include your order ID and photos to speed up resolution.

Prices are set by partner printers and depend on material, quantity, and turnaround. Use the 'Request Quote' flow to receive competitive bids. Beware of very low bids â€” check printer reviews and verification badges.

# Quote System - Supabase Migration Guide ## Issue Fixed The `respondToQuote` error was caused by missing columns in the `quote_requests` table. The following columns were not present: - `status` (to track pending/quoted/accepted states) - `quoted_price` (to store the printer's quote price) - `printer_notes` (to store additional notes from the printer) - `delivery_time` (to store estimated delivery time)
